DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Comparative analysis of routing protocols for VoIP in a Wireless Mesh Backbone: a user perspective

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Internet Protocol Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work we select AODV, OLSR and HWMP routing protocols and focus on how they can affect the Quality of user Experience (QoE) with respect to VoIP on a wireless backbone. We calculated QoE by using a reviewed version of the E-model. Since that parameter is strongly correlated with some stochastic network variables it presents stochastic behaviour too. So, we discuss important issues needed to estimate QoE based parameters in a trusty way. Results showed that the average QoE kept acceptable only under AODV routing as the number of VoIP traffic was increased in the network.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this work we select AODV, OLSR and HWMP routing protocols and focus on how they can affect the Quality of user Experience (QoE) with respect to VoIP on a wireless backbone. We calculated QoE by using a reviewed version of the E-model. Since that parameter is strongly correlated with some stochastic network variables it presents stochastic behaviour too. So, we discuss important issues needed to estimate QoE based parameters in a trusty way. Results showed that the average QoE kept acceptable only under AODV routing as the number of VoIP traffic was increased in the network.

Ajuste Automбtico de Velocidade em Transmissхes HTTP Realizadas em Redes de Alta Latкncia
Controle de admissгo de chamadas VoIP em redes mesh sem ﬁo
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Call Admission Control for VoIP in Wireless Mesh Networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Esta dissertaзгo apresenta um protуtipo de controle de admissгo para chamadas VoIP, de- nominado CAC, em rede mesh sem ﬁo, que utiliza o protocolo IEEE 802.11g. Seu uso visa prevenir que a chegada de novas chamadas VoIP na rede consuma excessivamente recursos dos nуs e causem degradaзгo nos ﬂuxos jб estabelecidos, devido o congestionamento do meio sem ﬁo. Em nossa pesquisa, o controle de admissгo proposto sу aceitarб novas chamadas VoIP caso a qualidade das chamadas em andamento nгo se torne insatisafatуria. As principais caracterнsticas de nossa proposta sгo: (i) a estimativa do tempo de ocupaзгo do nу com trбfego VoIP e trбfego que nгo necessita de requisitos de qualidade, denominado BE (Best effort); (ii) a reserva de recursos para trбfego VoIP; (iii) a integraзгo do protуtipo ao protocolo de roteamento prу-ativo OLSR (usando o envio de mensagens de controle com informaзхes sobre o tempo de ocupaзгo do nу com trбfego BE e VoIP); (iv) a estimativa sobre a interferкncia intra-ﬂuxo integrada ao controle de admissгo; (v) regulagem do trбfego BE; e (vi) a priorizaзгo do envio e recebimento do trбfego VoIP. Inicialmente, o protуtipo foi avaliado a partir de simulaзхes de uma rede mesh sem ﬁo em um cenбrio em que todos os nуs sгo vizinhos e considerando duas variaзхes: na primeira hб somente trбfego VoIP e na segunda, trбfego VoIP e BE. Foram medidos e avaliados a perda e atrasos de pacotes das chamadas VoIP, assim como os valores do MOS (Mean of Score), que indica a satisfaзгo do usuбrio. No cenбrio em que os nуs vizinhos sу trafegam VoIP e nгo й utilizado o CAC desenvolvido, а medida que a quantidade de chamadas VoIP cresce, sua qualidade й reduzida atй que se torna inviбvel o uso do VoIP na rede. Com o uso do CAC, obteve-se ganhos de atй 70% no valor do MOS medido a partir da rejeiзгo de algumas chamadas. Alйm disso, houve reduзгo de atй 82% e 96%, respectivamente, nas perdas de pacotes e atrasos. Jб no cenбrio
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This thesis presents a prototype of admission control for VoIP calls in wireless mesh network using the IEEE 802.11g protocol. This admission control goal is to avoid that incoming VoIP data ﬂows consume excessive resources and cause degradation in the established ones. The admission control proposed in our approach only accepts new VoIP calls if the in progress calls quality does not become damaged. The main features of our approach are: (i) an estimated ocupation time of nodes with VoIP trafﬁc and with trafﬁc without quality requirements, so called BE (Best effort); (ii) the resources reserve for VoIP trafﬁc; (iii) an integration of our prototype to the OLSR pro-active routing protocol (sending control messages with information about the business node time with BE and VoIP trafﬁc); (iv) an intra-ﬂow interference estimate with admission control integrated; (v) regulation for BE trafﬁc; and (vi) prioritization to sending and receiving VoIP trafﬁc. The prototype was initially evaluated by simulations of a wireless mesh network in a scena- rio where all nodes are neighbours, considering two variations: the ﬁrst one has only VoIP data ﬂows and the second has VoIP and BE data ﬂows. We measured the packet loss and the delays of VoIP calls and evaluated the MOS ( textit (Mean Score of)) measure indicating the user’s satisfaction. In the ﬁrst scenario variation, without CAC, when the amount of calls VoIP incre- ases, their quality are decreased (indicated by the MOS value measured). Using the proposed calls admission control (CAC) some calls were rejected and the gains is about 70% in the MOS value measured. Besides there was a reduction up to 82% and 96%, respectively, in packets losses and delays. In the second variation the proposed CAC to avoid reduction to about 29% of VoIP with quality over 3.5, and reduces too the damagethe packet VoIP losses uppon 86 %. In

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Call Admission Control for VoIP in Wireless Mesh Networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Esta dissertaзгo apresenta um protуtipo de controle de admissгo para chamadas VoIP, de- nominado CAC, em rede mesh sem ﬁo, que utiliza o protocolo IEEE 802.11g. Seu uso visa prevenir que a chegada de novas chamadas VoIP na rede consuma excessivamente recursos dos nуs e causem degradaзгo nos ﬂuxos jб estabelecidos, devido o congestionamento do meio sem ﬁo. Em nossa pesquisa, o controle de admissгo proposto sу aceitarб novas chamadas VoIP caso a qualidade das chamadas em andamento nгo se torne insatisafatуria. As principais caracterнsticas de nossa proposta sгo: (i) a estimativa do tempo de ocupaзгo do nу com trбfego VoIP e trбfego que nгo necessita de requisitos de qualidade, denominado BE (Best effort); (ii) a reserva de recursos para trбfego VoIP; (iii) a integraзгo do protуtipo ao protocolo de roteamento prу-ativo OLSR (usando o envio de mensagens de controle com informaзхes sobre o tempo de ocupaзгo do nу com trбfego BE e VoIP); (iv) a estimativa sobre a interferкncia intra-ﬂuxo integrada ao controle de admissгo; (v) regulagem do trбfego BE; e (vi) a priorizaзгo do envio e recebimento do trбfego VoIP. Inicialmente, o protуtipo foi avaliado a partir de simulaзхes de uma rede mesh sem ﬁo em um cenбrio em que todos os nуs sгo vizinhos e considerando duas variaзхes: na primeira hб somente trбfego VoIP e na segunda, trбfego VoIP e BE. Foram medidos e avaliados a perda e atrasos de pacotes das chamadas VoIP, assim como os valores do MOS (Mean of Score), que indica a satisfaзгo do usuбrio. No cenбrio em que os nуs vizinhos sу trafegam VoIP e nгo й utilizado o CAC desenvolvido, а medida que a quantidade de chamadas VoIP cresce, sua qualidade й reduzida atй que se torna inviбvel o uso do VoIP na rede. Com o uso do CAC, obteve-se ganhos de atй 70% no valor do MOS medido a partir da rejeiзгo de algumas chamadas. Alйm disso, houve reduзгo de atй 82% e 96%, respectivamente, nas perdas de pacotes e atrasos. Jб no cenбrio
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This thesis presents a prototype of admission control for VoIP calls in wireless mesh network using the IEEE 802.11g protocol. This admission control goal is to avoid that incoming VoIP data ﬂows consume excessive resources and cause degradation in the established ones. The admission control proposed in our approach only accepts new VoIP calls if the in progress calls quality does not become damaged. The main features of our approach are: (i) an estimated ocupation time of nodes with VoIP trafﬁc and with trafﬁc without quality requirements, so called BE (Best effort); (ii) the resources reserve for VoIP trafﬁc; (iii) an integration of our prototype to the OLSR pro-active routing protocol (sending control messages with information about the business node time with BE and VoIP trafﬁc); (iv) an intra-ﬂow interference estimate with admission control integrated; (v) regulation for BE trafﬁc; and (vi) prioritization to sending and receiving VoIP trafﬁc. The prototype was initially evaluated by simulations of a wireless mesh network in a scena- rio where all nodes are neighbours, considering two variations: the ﬁrst one has only VoIP data ﬂows and the second has VoIP and BE data ﬂows. We measured the packet loss and the delays of VoIP calls and evaluated the MOS ( textit (Mean Score of)) measure indicating the user’s satisfaction. In the ﬁrst scenario variation, without CAC, when the amount of calls VoIP incre- ases, their quality are decreased (indicated by the MOS value measured). Using the proposed calls admission control (CAC) some calls were rejected and the gains is about 70% in the MOS value measured. Besides there was a reduction up to 82% and 96%, respectively, in packets losses and delays. In the second variation the proposed CAC to avoid reduction to about 29% of VoIP with quality over 3.5, and reduces too the damagethe packet VoIP losses uppon 86 %. In
